Sequence Information.Peptide Name: Amphiphatic peptide CT2 (VmCT2; Non-disulfide-bridged peptide 5.14, NDBP-5.14; Arthropods, animal
Sequence Information.Family: Belongs to the scorpion NDBP 5 family
Sequence Information.Target Organism: [Ref.22342498]Gram-positive bacteria:Staphylococcus aureus ATCC 25923 (MIC=10 uM), Bacillus subtilis ATCC 6633 (MIC=20 µM), Streptococcus agalactiae (clinical isolate) (MIC=20 µM);Gram-negative bacteria:Escherichia coli ATCC 25922 (MIC=20 µM), Salmonella typhi ATCC 6399 (MIC=10 µM), Pseudomonas aeruginosa ATCC 9027 (MIC=10 µM).
Sequence Information.Hemolytic Activity: [Ref.22342498]25% hemolytic activity at 25 μM, 84% hemolytic activity at 50 μM against human erythrocytes
Sequence Information.Function: Amphipatic peptide that shows antibacterial activities against both Gram-positive and Gram-negative bacteria. Has hemolytic at its MIC range, but shows a strong cytotoxic activity at higher concentrations, reaching 84% lysis at 50 µM.

Literature.Title: Gene cloning and functional characterization of four novel antimicrobial-like peptides from scorpions of the family Vaejovidae.
